statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Luke Hancock scored 14 points and Ryan Pearson added 13 to lead George Mason to a 66-53 win over Harvard on Saturday.
article.headline: Jeremy Lin-less Harvard opens season with loss to George Mason
article.linkText: Lin-less Harvard falls short in season opener
article.story: FAIRFAX, Va. -- Luke Hancock scored 14 points and Ryan Pearson added 13 to lead George Mason to a 66-53 win over Harvard on Saturday. Cam Long added eight points, 10 rebounds and six assists as the Patriots won their eighth consecutive season opener. Harvard, which was led by 22 points and 16 rebounds by Keith Wright, struggled in its first game without Jeremy Lin, who is now with the Golden State Warriors. The Crimson shot just 32.7 percent from the field and committed 24 turnovers, leading to 24 points by George Mason. Hancock had the hot hand in the first half, scoring nine points and spurring an 8-0 run that pushed George Mason to a 21-14 lead with 7:18 remaining in the half. In the second half, Andre Cornelius had consecutive layups off steals during a 14-0 run that extended the Patriots' lead to 53-33 with just over 9 minutes to play.
